intro: Linaria elymaitica, commonly known as the Elymian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Linaria elymaitica is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare or endangered species in some parts of its native range.
